intro: Calyptranthes luquillensis, commonly known as the Luquillo calyptranthe, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
